rooftop_solar_bess_ppa.note: NWL and Timberworx will take rooftop solar and BESS on PPA basis with third parties. No capex required — power procured under Power Purchase Agreement. Reduces grid dependency and operating costs.

power.note: Inter-company electricity from LanRED solar at Eskom -10%; MABR technology ~0.4 kWh/m3; CAS (Conventional Activated Sludge) benchmark ~1.2 kWh/m3

coe_rent.note: Rent = CoE CapEx × (WACC + O&M overhead). WACC = 85% Senior + 15% Mezz facility rates. Mirrors TWX coe_lease.

smart_city_power_demand.note: Lanseria Infrastructure Funding Report (March 2020): 4 phases totalling ~90 MVA. 15,000 houses × 6kVA × 0.7 diversity × 1.5 commercial = 94.5 MW. Current Phase 1 (2.4 MWp) is catalytic seed = 0.5% of ultimate demand.

solar_capacity.note: Capacity derived from assets.json solar_001 budget ÷ cost_per_kWp. SA C&I benchmark R15,000/kWp = EUR 728/kWp (mid-range R12k-18k). At EUR 728/kWp → ~3.2 MWp. 21.5% CF (Gauteng fixed-tilt).

battery_storage.note: BESS capacity derived from assets.json solar_002 budget ÷ cost_per_kWh. SA C&I benchmark R7,500/kWh = EUR 364/kWh (mid-range R6k-10k). At EUR 364/kWh → ~1.7 MWh. 456 cycles/yr (2-cycle: HD 182 + LD 274). Degradation 3% at 456 cycles (benchmark: 2% at 260, 4% at 730).

ic_nwl.note: IC power to NWL at Eskom -10%. Share calculated from NWL water volume × kWh/m3 demand. R2.81 = Eskom business tariff (2024/25).

smart_city_offtake.note: Smart City absorbs nearly all generation (90 MW demand vs 2.4 MWp supply). Ramps from 50% in Y3 to 94% by Y5 (remaining 6% = NWL IC demand-driven share). Joburg business tariff -10%.

open_market.note: Residual capacity sold to open market via wheeling. Share = 100% minus NWL minus Smart City minus BESS.

low_demand_season.cycle_note: Only Cycle 2 (solar→peak) in LD season. Cycle 1 (grid→peak) spread too thin (R0.11).

bess_arbitrage.note: 2-cycle seasonal BESS arbitrage. Eskom Homeflex TOU rates (2024/25). HD: 2 cycles/day (grid→morning peak + solar→evening peak). LD: 1 cycle/day (solar→evening peak only — grid spread R0.11 not worth cycling). Must-run substation, pure arbitrage play.

grid_services.note: Grid wheeling and capacity payments (future revenue stream)

om.note: Solar O&M: R120k/yr fixed + R0.05/kWh variable (industry standard ~1% of capex)

grid_connection.note: Grid connection availability charge from Eskom/City Power

brownfield_plus.nwl_dedicated_note: NWL backup (118 kWp + 280 kWh, 8h BESS + 8h solar) via off-book PPA. Not in SCLCA structure.
brownfield_plus.phase2_note: Lanseria solar expansion (1.37 MWp for Smart City) funded from Northlands retained earnings Y2-Y3.

lanseria_demand.note: Lanseria Smart City housing demand (GEPF land). 15,000 in 5yr, 45,000 in 10yr. Each house = 3.2 people, 6 kVA (SA municipal standard). Commercial multiplier 1.5x for schools/shops/offices.

phase_1.note: Current: JV with Greenblocks, renting assets + HR. R130k/month.

phase_2.note: Optimat panel machines (Finland). COD 6 months — capacity ramp-up starts Y1. 3x Phase 1 capacity.

phase_3.note: Fully automated production. Finnish Govt funding €500k feasibility study. 1yr from Phase 2.

coe_facility.note: Centre of Excellence: 2,500 sqm facility. COD at M18. Dual-track training: timber + water/sanitation.

coe_lease.note: Rental income from CoE tenants (timber companies, training providers). Revenue = CoE CapEx × (WACC + O&M overhead) × occupancy.

coe_sale_to_llc.note: CoE sold to Lanseria LLC at 10% premium in Year 4. Stops rental income after sale. NWL rental obligation also stops.

training_programs.note: SETA-accredited training: timber construction + water/sanitation (NWL synergy). 2x original capacity for dual-track. Starts at CoE COD (M18). Stops after CoE sale to LLC (Y4). SETA = Sector Education and Training Authority — government body that funds skills development via mandatory employer levies (1% of payroll). Accredited training providers receive R8k/student subsidy.

timber_sales.note: SERVICE MODEL: TWX factory produces timber panels (capacity, quality, throughput). NOT an EPC — TWX Trade procures timber, Greenblocks erects on-site, EPCF finances. TWX cost = labor only. Phase 1: R130k/month (1 house/week, JV with Greenblocks) = R30k/house. Scales linearly with production. Revenue and labor both escalate 5% p.a. Pipeline: R178M across 10 projects.

om.note: CoE O&M: R180k/yr fixed + 5% of revenue variable (facilities management, utilities, security)
